headline: Cherry Chocolate Cake
description: This moist cherry chocolate cake is easy to make with pantry ingredients and cherry pie filling; top with chocolate frosting for a rich, chocolaty treat.
name: Cherry Chocolate Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease and flour one 9x13-inch baking pan.

Beat sugar and butter together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla extract. Add cocoa powder and mix until well combined.
Combine cake flour, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl; add flour mixture to butter mixture and mix until just combined. Stir in cherry pie filling. Pour batter into the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted near the middle comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Very good cake. I make this same cake using a boxed devils food cake mix, 1 tsp. almond extract, 2 eggs and a can of cherry pie filling. It's basically the same recipe only faster. I put it in a oiled bundt pan and bake it for approx. 30 minutes. The glaze is made of 5 tablespoons of butter, 1/3 cup milk and 1 cup white sugar mix and bring to boil for 2 minutes, remove from heat and add 1 cup chocolate chips....put on the cooled cake and garnish with halves of maraschino cherries. Wonderful easy version of this same cake. It can also be made in a 9x13" pan (which I spray with cooking oil with flour)....Both the recipe submitted and the easier version is wonderful!

Light, satisfying with our favorite combination of cherry and chocolate. I made a buttercream frosting but gave our guests the choice to add the frosting to their slices or sprinkle with powdered sugar. Delicious!
Used monk fruit sweetener, sugar free pie filling and vanilla extract. It is a very nice and easy recipe so I was able to use substitution for the things I can't eat.

A very moist and chocolaty cake. The recipe ingredients list almond extract, but the instructions say vanilla extract. I went with the almond extract, and in the future, I’ll add another 1/2 to 1 teaspoon. When you have a bite with a cherry in it, it pops, but I think additional almond extract would enhance the cherry flavor in the cake itself which is a bit weak. I chose not to add frosting and just gave it a dusting of confectioners sugar, and that was not a mistake in my opinion. This cake is good and sweet enough, so I don’t think you need sugary frosting; just enjoy the cherry-chocolate flavor in the cake. I don’t think an addition of a few chocolate chips in the batter would hurt this cake either.
I used regular all purpose flour. Super moist. One of my favorites, and worth repeating. I used a recommended chocolate buttercream frosting that was not too sweet but yummy!

It is an excellent cake. My changes were to make it in two 9 inch layer cake pans. I thought the frosting would be too sweet so I used whiped cream instead. I also saved a few cherries from the cherry pie filling for decoration. It came out great. Eveerybody loved it.
Easy to make and tastes amazing! I used a ceramic casserole dish, so I had to increase the baking time to 50 minutes.
For someone with a sweet tooth, it was way to sweet for my personal taste.
Cherry Chocolate Cake by Ginger McKenney. Use two cans filling. Use recipe with thick cake batter. Reduce sugar in cake by 1/3c. Saving mostly for idea.
It does not look like the picture of the cake.
